mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn114:4.2.pli: “imassa kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
mn114:4.2.en: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

mn114:12.1.pli: Imassa kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
mn114:12.1.en: Sir, that’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”

mn114:13.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, sāriputta, imassa mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāsi.
mn114:13.2.en: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way.”

mn114:23.2.pli: “imassa kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
mn114:23.2.en: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

mn114:30.6.pli: Imassa kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
mn114:30.6.en: Sir, that’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”

mn114:31.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, sāriputta, imassa mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāsi.
mn114:31.2.en: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way.”

mn114:40.2.pli: “imassa kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
mn114:40.2.en: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

mn114:49.1.pli: Imassa kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
mn114:49.1.en: Sir, that’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”

mn114:50.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, sāriputta, imassa mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāsi.
mn114:50.2.en: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way.”

mn114:60.1.pli: Sabbepi ce, sāriputta, khattiyā imassa mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājāneyyuṁ, sabbesānampissa khattiyānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya.
mn114:60.1.en: “If all the aristocrats, brahmins, peasants, and menials were to understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way, it would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.

mn114:60.5.pli: Sadevakopi ce, sāriputta, loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī pajā sadevamanussā imassa mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājāneyya, sadevakassapissa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
mn114:60.5.en: If the whole world—with its gods, Māras, and divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—was to understand the detailed meaning of my brief statement in this way, it would be for the whole world’s lasting welfare and happiness.”

mlDocs.title:

What Should and Should Not Be Cultivated

sn1.20:22.1.pli: “Na khvāhaṁ, bhante, imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
sn1.20:22.1.en: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

sn1.20:22.2.pli: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tathā bhāsatu yathāhaṁ imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ jāneyyan”ti.
sn1.20:22.2.en: Please teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”

sn1.20:24.1.pli: “Imassapi khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa na vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
sn1.20:24.1.en: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

sn1.20:24.2.pli: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tathā bhāsatu yathāhaṁ imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ jāneyyan”ti.
sn1.20:24.2.en: Please teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”

sn1.20:27.1.pli: “Imassa khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi—
sn1.20:27.1.en: “This is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement:

sn12.70:12.1.pli: “Na khvāhaṁ imassa āyasmantānaṁ saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.

sn35.95:11.1.en: “This is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement:

sn35.95:36.1.pli: Imassa khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn35.95:36.1.en: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”

sn35.95:36.3.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, mālukyaputta, mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāsi:
sn35.95:36.3.en: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.” And he repeated the verses in full.

sn35.95:41.1.pli: Imassa kho, mālukyaputta, mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṁ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti.
sn35.95:41.1.en: “This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”

mlDocs.title:

10. The Sixes
Māluṅkyaputta

sn12.31:3.1.pli: Imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṅkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṁ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti?
sn12.31:3.1.en: How should we see the detailed meaning of this brief statement?”

sn12.31:10.1.pli: Imassa khvāhaṁ, bhante, saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn12.31:10.1.en: This is how I understand the detailed meaning of what was said in brief.”

an10.220:3.1.pli: “Na kho ahaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
an10.220:3.1.en: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of what Mister Gotama has said in brief.

an10.220:3.2.pli: Sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu yathāhaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājāneyyan”ti.
an10.220:3.2.en: Please, Mister Gotama, teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”

mn18:15.4.pli: etthete pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhantī’ti, imassa kho ahaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi—
mn18:15.4.en: just this is the end of the underlying tendencies to desire, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, the desire to be reborn, and ignorance. This is the end of taking up the rod and the sword, the end of quarrels, arguments, and disputes, of accusations, divisive speech, and lies. This is where these bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over.’ This is how I understand the detailed meaning of this summary recital.

mn18:19.1.pli: Yaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
mn18:19.1.en: This is how I understand the detailed meaning of that brief summary recital given by the Buddha.
